main event: An unidentified aerial phenomenon was observed near Richmond, Virginia on September 1, 1952. The object appeared football-shaped and was described as self-luminous, intermittently visible, and about three times as large as a full moon.
interesting points: The object first appeared very bright and then rapidly faded until it was no longer visible, then reappeared for approximately half an hour.
Observers stated that it looked like a sparkler and its color was described as bluish-green.
The object was usually observed from the ground and was facing west, approximately 22.5 degrees above the horizon.
No intercept action was taken because the object was not reported until approximately 24 hours after the sighting.
The witness, Mr. and Mrs. *** reported the sighting and received a questionnaire from the Air Technical Intelligence Center to standardize the data and provide a complete record of the occurrence.
photographs: no photograph present in the report
